bibl.title: Military Orders for Walter Reed, April 13, 1875

div1.p: This series of endorsements by the Surgeon General and Secretary of War requests that Reed be assigned to a military post on the Atlantic Coast. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders for Walter Reed, April 13, 1875
div1.opener:
WAR DEPARTMENT RECEIVED APR 13 1875
1784 SGO 1875.
Lynnwood, Va.,
April 13, 1875.
Hon. John F. Lewis.
Request assignment of
Assist. Surg. W. Reed
to duty in N.Y. Harbor or at Fort Monroe.
USA
Surg. General
Report recd. April 20, 1875
2nd Endorsement
Surgeon General's Office,
April 20th, 1875
div1.p:
Respectfully returned to the
Hon. the Secretary of War, and
attention invited to the endor=
=sement from this office of
the 19th instant, upon com=
=munication from the Hon.
John T. Harris, requesting
the assignment of Dr Walter
Reed to duty in New York Harbor,
or any post on the atlantic
coast north of North Carolina.
div1.closer:
W Barnes Surgeon General,
U.S. Army.

div1.head: Letter from William W. Belknap to John T. Lewis, April 22, 1875
div1.opener:
3386.
April 22nd 75
Hon. John T. Lewis
Lynnwood, Va.
Sir:
div1.p:
In reply to your letter of
the 13th instant, I have the honor
to inform you that Dr. Reed has
been examined and approved
by the Army Medical Board in
session in New York City for
appointment as Assistant
Surgeon but has not yet been
appointed.

After appointment the Surgeon
General contemplates requesting that
he be assinged to temporary duty
at one of the largest military posts
for instruction.

He declined employment as
Acting Assistant Surgeon, until
such time as he could be ap-
pointed Assistant Surgeon, but if he
now desires to go on duty a contract
will be made with him for the purpose
above mentioned
div1.closer:
Very respectfully
Your obedient servant Wm W Belknap Secretary of War
